intro: Mentha arvensis var. zollingeri, commonly known as Zollinger's field mint, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its aromatic, serrated leaves and flowering spikes that produce small, pale blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. It is a member of the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is known for its strong, minty aroma. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
